page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: In contrast to the larger farming units in our area, one farm is still run on very traditional lines. It is a unit of only 190 acres and is labour intensive, employing 4 men full time, and up to 20 during busy seasons. Vegetables - onions, leeks, cabbages, cauliflowers, calabrese and turnips - are grown for local and distant markets. In common with the other farms in the area, this farm also buys in cattle from the upland farms in the autumn for fattening overwinter indoors, and, to some extent, on the fallow fields the following spring. Unlike the others, however, this farm runs about 100 head of sheep, mainly for their lambs, but also for their fleeces, which are still clipped with hand shears on the farm itself.
